data.text: For touring I would recommend getting sintered/metal pads, no matter what disc brakes you opt for. Resin pads are cheaper and have more initial bite, you will slow faster in the beginning. But resin pads suffer from 'brake fade', as they heat up they become less effective. Sintered pads do not have the same initial bite, but they do not suffer from brake fade when they get hot. On a loaded bike, going down a long hill, you do not want brake fade.

data.text: You‚Äôll get longer pad and rotor life out of 180mm rotors, which no downside for touring requirements. Smaller rotors bring pads up to optimal temperature for bite faster, which is good for riding like cyclocross, xc MTB. But for touring, where bite isn‚Äôt a priority, and extended braking and heat management is more of a priority, 180 is ideal.
